trans-unit.source: View events and audit logs
trans-unit.target: View events and audit logs

trans-unit.source: Learn how to see all of the events that happen in your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to see all of the events that happen in your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: All operations performed on Azure resources are fully audited by the Azure Resource Manager, from creation and deletions to granting or revoking access.
trans-unit.target: All operations performed on Azure resources are fully audited by the Azure Resource Manager, from creation and deletions to granting or revoking access.

trans-unit.source: You can browse these logs in the Azure portal, and you can also use the <linkText>REST API</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>.NET SDK</linkText><title></title> to access the full set of events programmatically.
trans-unit.target: You can browse these logs in the Azure portal, and you can also use the <linkText>REST API</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>.NET SDK</linkText><title></title> to access the full set of events programmatically.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click on the Browse and select Audit logs.
trans-unit.target: Click on the Browse and select Audit logs.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Browse Hub</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Browse Hub</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This will open up a blade showing all of the events that have impacted any of your subscriptions for the past 7 days.
trans-unit.target: This will open up a blade showing all of the events that have impacted any of your subscriptions for the past 7 days.

trans-unit.source: At the top is a chart showing data by level, and below that is the full list of logs: <linkText>All events</linkText>
trans-unit.target: At the top is a chart showing data by level, and below that is the full list of logs: <linkText>All events</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can only view the 500 most recent events for a given subscription in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: You can only view the 500 most recent events for a given subscription in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: You can click on any log entry to see the events that made it up.
trans-unit.target: You can click on any log entry to see the events that made it up.

trans-unit.source: For example, when you deploy something to a resource group, many different resources may be created or modified.
trans-unit.target: For example, when you deploy something to a resource group, many different resources may be created or modified.

trans-unit.source: For each entry you can see:
trans-unit.target: For each entry you can see:

trans-unit.source: The Level of the event - for example, it could be just something to track (Informational), or when something has gone wrong that you need to know about (Error).
trans-unit.target: The Level of the event - for example, it could be just something to track (Informational), or when something has gone wrong that you need to know about (Error).

trans-unit.source: The Status - the final status will generally be Succeeded or Failed, but it may also be Accepted for long-running operations.
trans-unit.target: The Status - the final status will generally be Succeeded or Failed, but it may also be Accepted for long-running operations.

trans-unit.source: When the event occurred.
trans-unit.target: When the event occurred.

trans-unit.source: Who performed the operation, if anyone.
trans-unit.target: Who performed the operation, if anyone.

trans-unit.source: Not all operations are performed by users, some are performed by backend services so they would not have a Caller.
trans-unit.target: Not all operations are performed by users, some are performed by backend services so they would not have a Caller.

trans-unit.source: The Correlation ID of the event - this is the unique identifier for this set of operations.
trans-unit.target: The Correlation ID of the event - this is the unique identifier for this set of operations.

trans-unit.source: From there you can go to the details blade to see the specifics of the event.
trans-unit.target: From there you can go to the details blade to see the specifics of the event.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Resource groups</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Resource groups</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For Failed events, this page usually includes a Substatus and a Properties section that include useful details for debugging purposes.
trans-unit.target: For Failed events, this page usually includes a Substatus and a Properties section that include useful details for debugging purposes.

trans-unit.source: In order to see events that apply to a specific entity, or of a specific type, you can filter the Audit logs blade by clicking the Filter command.
trans-unit.target: In order to see events that apply to a specific entity, or of a specific type, you can filter the Audit logs blade by clicking the Filter command.

trans-unit.source: You also use the Filter blade to change the Time span of the Audit logs blade.
trans-unit.target: You also use the Filter blade to change the Time span of the Audit logs blade.

trans-unit.source: Once you click this command, a new blade will open:
trans-unit.target: Once you click this command, a new blade will open:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Filter</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Filter</linkText>

trans-unit.source: There are four types of filters:
trans-unit.target: There are four types of filters:

trans-unit.source: By subscription
trans-unit.target: By subscription

trans-unit.source: By a Resource group
trans-unit.target: By a Resource group

trans-unit.source: By a Resource type
trans-unit.target: By a Resource type

trans-unit.source: By a particular Resource - for this you must past in the full Resource ID of the resource you are interested in
trans-unit.target: By a particular Resource - for this you must past in the full Resource ID of the resource you are interested in

trans-unit.source: In addition, you can also filter events by who performed the event, or, by the level of the event.
trans-unit.target: In addition, you can also filter events by who performed the event, or, by the level of the event.

trans-unit.source: Once you have finished choosing what you want to see, click the Update button at the bottom of the blade.
trans-unit.target: Once you have finished choosing what you want to see, click the Update button at the bottom of the blade.

trans-unit.source: Click on Browse to find the resource you are interested in.
trans-unit.target: Click on Browse to find the resource you are interested in.

trans-unit.source: You can also see all of the logs for an entire Resource group.
trans-unit.target: You can also see all of the logs for an entire Resource group.

trans-unit.source: On the resource's blade, scroll down until you find the Events tile.
trans-unit.target: On the resource's blade, scroll down until you find the Events tile.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Events tile</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Events tile</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click on that tile to see events filtered to just the resource that you selected.
trans-unit.target: Click on that tile to see events filtered to just the resource that you selected.

trans-unit.source: You can use the Filter command to change the time range or apply more specific filters.
trans-unit.target: You can use the Filter command to change the time range or apply more specific filters.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Receive alert notifications</linkText><title></title> whenever an event happens.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Receive alert notifications</linkText><title></title> whenever an event happens.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Monitor service metrics</linkText><title></title> to make sure your service is available and responsive.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Monitor service metrics</linkText><title></title> to make sure your service is available and responsive.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Track service health</linkText><title></title> to find out when Azure has experienced performance degradation or service interruptions.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Track service health</linkText><title></title> to find out when Azure has experienced performance degradation or service interruptions.
